descriptionShort: BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer. General Description: This position reports directly into the Associate Director of Manufacturing Sciences Technology Purification. The position a critical role within the MST Purification laboratories and activities, included but not limited to chromatography, filtration tangential flow, depth, viral and dead end, and therefore previous experience is required. The position will be responsible for design and execution of laboratory experiments, data analysis and authoring of various reports. Position will support technology transfers activities, including but not limited to mass balance calculations, buffer calculations and assignment, bill of materials generation, facility fit and material gap analysis, manufacturing process flow diagrams, and authoring of process description and process control strategies. Position will support technology transfers, process improvements, troubleshooting, compliance related activities and provide technical support to manufacturing. The position also will play a leadership role within the laboratory, and as such will be responsible in authoring department standard operating procedures and training junior staff, maintaining raw material and consumable inventory. The position will support regulatory filing, through authoring of required regulatory sections, answering to regulatory authority questions and participate in various internal and external regulatory inspections. Working in MST laboratory provides a unique growth opportunity for professional exposure to many facets of process development and drug substance manufacturing. This position involves close collaboration with Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Procurement, Quality Control, Quality Assurance, Regulatory, and Process Development groups. In addition, as the BeiGene Hopewell progresses through various phases of the Green-Field Project to becoming fully operational, it provides unique opportunities and challenges to anyone who is looking for career advancement. Essential Job Functions: Participate in cross-functional projects teams that provide tech support to manufacturing and process development, and able to present data and study findings in coherent manner. Ensure a safe working environment. Responsible for execution of laboratory experiments and maintaining support laboratory activities. Authoring of study protocols and reports, and other documentation supporting deviations and regulatory activities. Perform tech transfer activities, including facility gap and risk assessments. Provide technical support as SME for implementation of cell culture processes. Author technical transfer plans, process descriptions, control strategies, and campaign summary reports. Author Process validation plan, PPQ protocols, and various upstream study protocols to support PPQ. Perform Continued Process Verification CPV and process monitoring during campaigns. Effective communication with team members and stakeholders is a must. Serve as Person-In-Plant PIP during critical steps of the manufacturing process, when required. Perform manufacturing data analysis as required. Participate in and support on-site supervision and management of contract employees or parties as required by BeiGene. Any other assignment as is determined by the manager. Technical Skills Required: Expertise in Green-Field Projects for Mab Facilities and Process Design Development. Expertise in equipment identification procurement as well as DQ, IOQ and Validation activities. Expertise with chromatography systems AKTA, tangential flow filtration, analytical equipment. Ability and aptitude for analyzing data, detecting inconsistencies, determining relative importance, and utilizing data and risk analysis tools. Experience with downstream process design, optimization, and tech transfer to clinical commercial manufacturing facilities. Expertise with study design such as DOE and authoring of study protocols reports. Good understanding of GMP requirements. Proven planning and data analysis skills, use of statistical software to analyze data Project management skills related to internal and external teams Knowledge of regulations and guidelines of FDA, EMA, ICH, PDA. Working Experience: BA-BS or higher in science, biochemistry, biotechnology, biology, chemical engineering and or related discipline Minimum of of experience in the Life Science Biotechnology. Demonstrated experience working in purification laboratory. Knowledge of drug preclinical, clinical and commercial requirements. Familiarity with EMA and FDA regulatory requirements for submissions. Effective communication, oral and written, in a multi-disciplinary, project-driven work environment. Experience with software such as Microsoft Office and SAP. Physical Requirements: Must be able to reach above shoulder level, bend stoop, push pull, and handle grip frequently. Must be able to work scheduled 40 hours with the ability to work overtime as needed. Must be comfortable in working in varying temperatures. Ability to gown and work in manufacturing areas, when required. Some reaching, bending, stooping, and twisting Repetitive motion and substantial movement of the wrists, hands, and or fingers. Environment requires dedicated gowns, depending on area. Work with hazardous materials and chemicals. Willing to work off shift, when required. Computer Skills: MS Office, JMP Other Qualifications: N A Travel: BeiGene Global Competencies When we exhibit our values of Patients First, Collaborative Spirit, Bold Ingenuity and Driving Excellence, through our global competencies below, we help get more affordable medicines to more patients around the world. Fosters Teamwork Provides and Solicits Honest and Actionable Feedback Self-Awareness Acts Inclusively Demonstrates Initiative Entrepreneurial Mindset Continuous Learning Embraces Change Results-Oriented Analytical Thinking Data Analysis Financial Excellence Communicates with Clarity

descriptionShort: Job Description ABOUT BOSE You know the moment. It's the notes of that song you love, the intro to your favorite movie, or simply the sound of someone you love saying hello. It's in these moments that sound matters most. Innovation is more than what we do. It's who we are - constantly learning and constantly curious. We never stop imagining what better sound sounds like. We're music fanatics and audio engineers. We're explorers and inventors and dreamers. And we're passionate down to our bones about making whatever you're listening to a little more magical. ABOUT THE ROLE At Bose, we aim to bring products into the world that people truly love, and we don't stop until the details are just right. Data science, machine learning, and analytics are a crucial part of this mission. These capabilities fuel the creation of new and innovative products, helping us to bring the right products to the right customers, and allow us to astonish customers with carefully crafted and personalized experiences. We are looking for Senior Data Scientist, ideally with a background in time series forecasting, to join our Data Science team within our Data and Analytics CoE. As a data scientist within the CoE, your mission will be to develop world-class AI, data science, machine learning, and related solutions to solve for our biggest challenges. Within this role you will focus on driving the strategy for and building the next generation of supply chain and demand forecasting models. You will work with a cross-functional team of data scientists and partner with teams from across Bose to influence decisions that will drive a significant impact to our bottom-line and our customers. Responsibilities: Engage with business partners and stakeholders to understand business problems and translate them into data science solutions. Coordinate and collaborate with data science, data engineering, analytic engineering, and other resources to achieve business goals. Work cross-functionally with sales, product, marketing, and engineering on optimization opportunities and insights. Lead and contribute to the end-to-end development and deployment of predictive and prescriptive models, with a focus on supply chain and demand forecasting. Explore large datasets using modeling, analysis, and visualization techniques. Communicate results, analyses, and methodologies to technical and non-technical senior level stakeholders. Ability to mentor, coach, and lead others. Contribute to and help build ML AI vision to support business strategy. ABOUT YOU MS or PhD in Data Science, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics Statistics, or a related field. of experience applying data science, AI machine learning, and analytics techniques to business problems. of experience leading data science projects Must have working in demand forecasting - exp in the space strongly preferred. Experience with machine learning and causal modeling techniques, with a focus on time-series forecasting. Experience solving real-world problems using programming languages such as SQL, Spark, and Python, and deploying solutions to enterprise systems Excellent strategic thinking, communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills, including working with and articulating results to senior business stakeholders. Experience with and understanding of project management tools and principles Ideal candidates will have experience in cold-start and in-market demand forecasting. Our goal is to create an atmosphere where every candidate feels supported and empowered in the interviewing process. Diversity and inclusion are integral to our success, and we believe that providing reasonable accommodation is not only a legal obligation but also a fundamental aspect of our commitment to being an employer of choice. We recognize that individuals may have different needs and requirements based on their abilities, and we provide reasonable accommodations to ensure ideal conditions are met during the application process. jobTitle: Data Scientist Workplace Operations Supply Chain
descriptionShort: The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. What's the role Bloomberg's Workplace Operations and Supply Chain Business Intelligence team continually improves our operations teams' ability to make data-driven decisions. You will help us to determine where potential opportunities exist, the information required to effectively analyze our processes, and how to use the findings to improve our operations and strengthen our business strategy. We're looking for a BI Analyst to join our team to build complex data models, create data visualizations, conduct robust statistical analysis, and build predictive data science models to help the business make smarter decisions. You will work hands-on developing data driven automations, business analytics applications that help monitor performance and identify opportunities for improvement across the organization. We'll trust you to: Generate ideas and identify opportunities for improvement from data about our facilities, supply chain, employee support, and other operations Operate as an internal consultant for our business teams in addressing strategic and operational issues to recommend actions supported with data and analysis Think beyond specific tasks, understand the goal, and ask the right questions to drive value for the business Build data models using Python, SQL, and data visualization software i.e., QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI Build intuitive and digestible dashboards and visualizations using Qliksense Perform robust analysis of large data sets to build classification, prediction, and regression models using the Python data science suite Collaborate with stakeholders on design and engineering to develop an understanding of needs Keep current with technical and industry standards in data science Effectively anticipate changes in the work environment and adapt accordingly You'll need to have: An undergraduate degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar A minimum of experience in analytics consulting, multivariate modeling, segmentation, quantitative methods, predictive models, and machine learning using Python Strong attention to detail and the ability to produce high quality presentation materials for senior leadership A minimum of advanced SQL skills and experience working with relational databases, knowledge of big data systems such as Hadoop and Spark Experience with data visualization software tools e.g. Qliksense, Tableau, Power BI, etc. Ability to work with and explain technical concepts to non-technical partners, and break down sophisticated business problems into achievable steps We'd love to see: of project management experience Past experience in strategy consulting Experience working within an Agile framework Does this sound like you Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know that the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https: www.bloomberg.com company what-we-do Bloomberg provides reasonable adjustment accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable adjustment accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable adjustment accommodation include but are not limited to making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email email protected , email protected , and , or email protected , based on the region you are submitting an application for. jobTitle: Decision Support Analyst at Johns Hopkins Medicine
descriptionShort: Summary: The Decision Support Analyst plays a vital role bridging the gap between data analysis and strategic decision-making. Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from various hospital departments, this professional identifies trends, patterns, and opportunities. They generate comprehensive reports, develop data visualizations, and provide actionable insights to support hospital operations, patient care, and financial planning Essential Functions Data Analysis and Interpretation: Consolidate data from multiple sources, including electronic health records EHR, financial systems, and operational databases. Conducts deep-dive analysis to identify trends, correlations, and opportunities for improvement. Interprets complex data sets and provide clear, actionable insights to support strategic initiatives and decision-making. Completes and cost accounting system updates. Reporting and Visualization: Develop and maintain standardized and ad-hoc reports for various hospital departments, ensuring accuracy and relevance. Customize reports based on departmental requirements and present findings to stakeholders in a comprehensible manner. Develop high quality, impactful dashboards using charts, graphs, drilldown, navigation and other data visualization techniques using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms Decision Support and Strategic Planning: Collaborate with team members in Finance to assess data needs and proactively provide decision support in areas such as resource allocation, service line optimization, and quality improvement. Assist in long-term strategic planning by analyzing market trends, forecasting patient volumes, and evaluating the impact of potential initiatives. Design, develop, and maintain spreadsheets, databases, and tracking tools for data collection, analysis, and evaluation of activities. Training and Support: Administer ERP security functions, including user access management, role creation, and authorization assignments, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and industry standards. Act as a point of contact for ERP-related queries, offering expertise and guidance to ensure secure and efficient system usage. Education: Requires a Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Healthcare Administration, or related field. Work Experience: Requires minimum of experience in decision support, preferably in a healthcare setting. Knowledge: Requires proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, and data visualization platforms Tableau, Power BI, etc. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including but not limited to Access, Excel, Outlook, and Word Preferred experience with programming skills like SQL, other languages Preferred knowledge of budget processes and financial analysis. Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are drug-free workplace employers. We are committed to providing a healthy and safe environment for our patients, visitors and staff members. The Johns Hopkins Hospital has a tobacco-free at work policy. Employees must refrain from using any tobacco products during their work shifts - including while at lunch or on breaks, and whether they are on or off campus. More Information on Johns Hopkins Medicine

You will oversee the revenue close, interface extensively with all aspects of the business and external auditors as needed. The role requires someone who has experience operating in a fast-paced public company environment tight reporting deadlines, global operations and requires attention to detail and follow through to scale business processes efficiently. This is an excellent opportunity for a high performing professional to join a dynamic team and provide cross-functional strategic business insights. descriptionShort: Job Summary: We are thrilled to announce that NOVA, a leading organization in advanced technology and data analysis, has been selected to undertake a highly prestigious project in collaboration with of our esteemed agencies. We are actively seeking talented individuals to join our team for this groundbreaking initiative, which is set to span over . The project is based in , , where you will have the chance to contribute to solving global challenges by transforming complex data sets into actionable information. As part of this exciting endeavor, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge analytics solutions, knowledge management artifacts, information sharing tools, data transformation techniques, and malware analysis capabilities. These focus areas will play a vital role in advancing our understanding of the ever-evolving threat landscape and enabling us to proactively address emerging challenges. Job Duties and Responsibilities: Employ some combination or more of the following areas: Foundations Mathematical, Computational, Statistical Data Processing Data management and curation, data description and visualization, workflow and reproducibility Modeling, Inference, and Prediction Data modeling and assessment, domain-specific considerations Devise strategies for extracting meaning and value from large datasets. Through analytic modeling, statistical analysis, programming coding, and or another appropriate scientific method, develop and implement qualitative and quantitative methods for characterizing, exploring, and assessing large datasets in various states of organization, cleanliness, and structure that account for the unique features and limitations inherent to key intelligence community data holdings. Translate practical mission needs and analytic questions related to large datasets into technical requirements and, conversely, assist others with drawing appropriate conclusions from the analysis of such data. Work with current project teams to support ongoing intelligence focused projects. Develop code program software to support ongoing project work with minimal supervision. Make and communicate principled conclusions from data using elements of mathematics, statistics, computer science, and application specific knowledge. Be able to ask questions and communicate issues and problems clearly to peers and management. Effectively communicate complex technical information to non-technical audiences. Can work with others easily and effectively. Make informed recommendations regarding competing technical solutions by maintaining awareness of the constantly shifting intelligence community collection, processing, storage and analytic capabilities and limitations. Have experience with statistical analysis e.g. variability, sampling error, inference, hypothesis testing, EDA, application of linear models College-level Algebra or other math courses intended to meet a basic college level requirement, or upper level math courses designated as elementary or basic do not count. Understand and have experience in data management e.g. data cleaning and transformation including, but not limited to, data mining, data modeling and assessment. Experience with artificial intelligence machine learning including both software development coding and operating AI ML systems and tools. Have experience with of the following computer languages in priority order: Python, Java, R, C, C or any other one that would be relevant. Experience with language is preferred. Experience with designing developing using evaluating mathematic models, methods, and or techniques e.g., algorithm development is a plus. Ability to understand and study issues and solve problems. descriptionShort: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe, and even making it possible to breathe on . Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future Advanced Materials AM is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films, and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors, and military protection. We are making the world safer, and cleaner and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions, and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain, and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers . Join Honeywell as a member of the AM team comprising of engineers and scientists. You will be the technical member working in the department consisting of these skill centers of , GC MS, ICP-OES, ICP-MS, , LC-MS, Wet chemical analysis, NMR, FTIR, SEM, and other similar analytical analyses. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Support research and development analytical characterization of the next-generation advanced materials especially fluorine products, fluorine-based Polymers, lithium-ion battery materials etc. Serve as the local expert for analytical characterization, novel capability built to understand Advanced Materials Research and Development and work closely with cross-functional Research and Development teams to develop core capabilities, technologies, measurement, and data analysis to identify critical capability, characterization data needed to develop, process, and scale up of these products. Design of advanced characterization methodologies for various Advanced Material to support discovery of novel formulations. Due to compliance with export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a Person, which is defined as, a citizen, a permanent resident, or have protected status in the under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization. YOU MUST HAVE M.S. in Chemistry, Polymer chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering. of analytical characterization of Advanced Materials and or fluorine products experience academia and or industry WE VALUE PhD in Chemistry, Electrochemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, or related field. Industrial experience in the fluorine products Demonstrated experience with Analytical Characterization e.g. GPC, GC, , LC-MS, Wet chemistry techniques, Extractions Demonstrated experience with 1D experiments with , 13C, 19F nuclei. Demonstrated capability of specialized experiments with focus on DEPT, HSQC, NOSEY and 2D COSY . Demonstrated capability of designing experiments to enable clear results that drive decisions in an industrial Research and Development environment Ability to ensure a high level of scientific rigor is applied to all projects Desire to work collaboratively with many internal teams in new molecule ideation, discovery, creation, and application Ability to plan, develop, and execute DOE for fabrication and testing of fluorine products A passion for scientific curiosity and creativity An open, honest, and team-oriented personality Eagerness to get involved in hands-on work, with a positive attitude and desire to acquire new skills quickly Creativity and desire in pushing the frontiers of science and knowledge to contribute positively to the growth of Honeywell Advanced Materials Additional Information Category: Engineering Location: , , NY 14210 Exempt Global ALL

descriptionShort: At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in , . Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people . We're looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world. Eli Lilly and Company seeks a Principal Scientist - TS MS to provide technical support for the development, implementation, and execution of a manufacturing execution system. Design and deliver MES production instructions and transition to support of routine manufacturing operations. Serve as the PMX TS MS subject matter expert and provide technical leadership to the PMX team related to process and ticket requirements for parenteral drug product manufacturing. Translate product control strategy and process flow document requirements into accurate instruction sets. Guide the change prioritization process, working with the business to understand change requirements and collaborating with IT to understand complexity. Participate in design reviews, final design specification reviews, and localization of PMX tickets. Provide technical support both for the initial start-up of the Formulation area as well as post-Process ValidationLI-DNI Position requires a Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmacy, or a related field, followed by of progressively responsible experience supporting cGMP manufacturing. Experience must include a minimum of: of experience with drug product manufacturing, including equipment, facilities, computer systems, and operations of experience in TS MS, MSAT, or Quality Assurance of experience with operational control strategy including CQA, CPP, and CIPC of experience with manufacturing execution system of experience building and testing in and of experience with formulation and project management. domestic and international travel required. Part time telecommuting may be permitted. LI-DNI Job location: , . To apply, please visit https: jobsearch.lilly.com and enter job requisition number R-59701 when prompted. Alternatively, please send your resume, cover letter, and a copy of the ad to: Beth L. Berry, Lilly Corporate Center, , IN . Our employee resource groups ERGs offer strong support networks for their members and help our company develop talented individuals for future leadership roles. Our current groups include: , , Central Asia Network, African American Network, Chinese Culture Network, Early Career Professionals, Japanese International Leadership Network JILN, Lilly India Network, Organization of Latinos at Lilly, PRIDE LGBTQ Allies, Veterans Leadership Network, Women's Network, Working and Living with Disabilities. Learn more about all of our groups. WeAreLilly More Information on Eli Lilly and Company

descriptionShort: We are a development, data science and design studio that works closely with founders and executives to create custom software and machine learning solutions. Are you excited about brain-computer interfaces BCIs and neurotechnology that increase human agency Are you a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and wants to tackle challenging engineering problems Do you want to work with a world-class remote team while having a big impact on meaningful projects We are looking for Data Scientists and Technical Product Managers to help us build the future of neurotechnology! About AE Studio AE Studio is a mid-sized startup from . We have a team of highly skilled developers, designers, and data scientists building products that increase human agency. We use the most recent technologies to develop solutions for startups as well as large companies like Samsung and Berkshire Hathaway. We have an awesome work environment and a highly productive process. At AE Studio, our central goal is to improve human agency through neurotechnology. We achieve this through in-house development, open-source projects, academic partnerships, and by supporting clients ranging from startups to established enterprises. We are looking for someone with experience in neurotechnology, machine learning, artificial intelligence, data engineering, strong problem-solving skills, self-management skills, and enthusiasm to learn more about the intersection of data science and neuroscience. About the Role You'll be part of a team working to create cutting-edge neurotechnology to improve human agency. We utilize an array of cutting-edge technologies, including EEG, arrays, ultrasound, fNIRS, and beyond. We work on every aspect of development from ideation, experimentation, software and machine learning development, and deployment. We collaborate on in-house non-profit projects and partner with clients to bring their visions to life. You will collaborate with our international BCI team, in addition to outside academic and industry organizations, in a semi-autonomous research and development role as we work together to accelerate the development of neurotechnology. You: Have a PhD or equivalent in a relevant field e.g. neuroscience, electrical engineering, physics, or mathematics Are fluent with Python, git, and software development best practices Have experience in of the following: neuroscience, biosignals, BCI experimentation and neural signal processing Possess experience in transforming research findings into practical product applications Have experience with working with deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorch Bonus Points For: A PhD or equivalent in a relevant field e.g. neuroscience, electrical engineering, physics, or mathematics Experience using AWS infrastructure , S3, databases, IAM, etc Proven expertise in leading teams to deliver top-notch code and exceptional products Proficient in working with real-time systems Please include a link to your public code repository e.g. GitHub in your application What we offer: Opportunity to work on world-changing technology Collaborative friendly remote work environment Good pay Reasonable flexible work hours

descriptionShort: ELEVI is looking to add a Data Scientist to our team. In order to join the Team you will need You must be willing to work in the Annapolis Junction, area. A CURRENT OR ACTIVE SECURITY CLEARANCE WITH POLY IS REQUIRED. Bachelor's and Master's degree from an accredited college or university in a quantitative discipline e.g., statistics, mathematics, operations research, engineering or computer science. of experience analyzing datasets and developing analytics of experience programming with data analysis software such as R, Python, SAS, or MATLAB of experience in software development, cloud development, analyzing datasets, or developing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics can be substituted for a Master's degree. A PhD from an accredited college or university in a quantitative discipline can be substituted for of experience. Experience with analysis in the cyber domain and discovery operations Experience with algorithm design and development in cloud environments. Required skills: - Produce data visualizations that provide insight into dataset structure and meaning - Work with subject matters experts SMEs to identify important information in raw data and develop scripts that extract this information from a variety of data formats e.g., SQL tables, structured metadata, network logs - Incorporate SME input into feature vectors suitable for analytic development and testing -Translate customer qualitative analysis process and goals into quantitative formulations that are coded into software prototypes - Develop and implement statistical, machine learning, and heuristic techniques to create descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics - Develop statistical tests to make data-driven recommendations and decisions - Develop experiments to collect data or models to simulate data when required data are unavailable - Develop feature vectors for input into machine learning algorithms - Identify the most appropriate algorithm for a given dataset and tune input and model parameters - Evaluate and validate the performance of analytics using standard techniques and metrics e.g. cross validation, curves, confusion matrices Some of your day-to-day activities: Work with a team to analyze and characterize large data sets, create data visualizations, and identify anomalous interesting behavior. Develop machine learning, data mining, statistical and graph-based algorithms to analyze and make sense of datasets prototype or consider several algorithms and decide upon final model based on suitable performance metrics Build models or develop experiments to generate data when training or example datasets are unavailable Generate reports and visualizations that summarize datasets and provide data-driven insights to customers Partner with subject matter experts to translate manual data analysis into automated analytics implement prototype algorithms within production frameworks for integration into analyst workflows. Why Work at ELEVI To become an ELEVI employee is to become an integral part of the team. From Federal to Commercial, ELEVI offers our employees the ability to expand skills and fully engage their minds and passions. Each member of the team enjoys the opportunity to expand their career to meet their individual goals and objectives. We celebrate the ideas that bring about positive change, and the diverse talents and backgrounds that come together to create those ideas.

descriptionShort: About Watershed Watershed is a software platform for running a world-class climate program. We measure our success in the carbon reduction achievements of our customers. We are looking for team members who love product-building, want to work hard at a mission-oriented startup, and will collaborate with us in shaping the culture of a growing team. We have offices in , and and remote team members across the and . We hope that you'll be interested in joining us! The role We are looking for a team member to work closely with cross-functional partners across the go-to-market organization, including our revenue operations, climate advisory, climate operations, and marketing teams. You will be joining as an early member of the team that will shape everything that comes next at Watershed. What you could work on: Building the Carbon Emissions funnel, tracking greenhouse gases emitted, measured, reported, and removed throughout our sales pipeline and product Developing a semantic layer for sales activity data, including defining key metrics such as customer LTV Developing sales and revenue forecasting methodology Using firmographic data, climate data and derived signals to develop models to identify prospects and understand the landscape of corporate climate action Owning major dashboards and visualizations that are critical to our sales, marketing, and customer success teams Designing and analyzing customer feedback and sentiment surveys Some traits that are important to our company culture: collaboration, ownership, intensity and care, and customer obsession both internal and external. And were looking for owners, so we hope youll help us expand this list. You might be a fit if you have: of industry experience Experience developing key business metrics and analyzing sales pipelines Fluency in SQL Experience working with business intelligence and data visualization tools Passion for collaboration across technical and non-technical teams 131,600250,000 USD FAQ Where does Watershed work We have hub offices in , and , and some remote team members in the and EU. Most of our jobs need to be in New York London, but certain jobs are open to being remote and will be specifically noted on the jobs page and in the job description. Whats the interview process like It starts the same for every candidate: getting to know the team members through conversations about Watershed, your experience, and your interests. Next steps can vary by role, but usual next steps are a skill or experience screen e.g. a coding interview for an engineer, a portfolio review for a designer, deeper experience call for other roles which leads to a virtual or in person interview panel after that if the screens go well. We prioritize transparency and lack of surprise throughout the process.

descriptionShort: Generation Bio is innovating genetic medicines to provide durable, redosable treatments for people living with rare and prevalent diseases. The companys non-viral platform incorporates a novel DNA construct called closed-ended DNA, or ceDNA a unique cell-targeted lipid nanoparticle delivery system, or ctLNP and a highly scalable capsid-free manufacturing process that uses its proprietary cell-free rapid enzymatic synthesis, or RES, to produce ceDNA. The platform is designed to enable multi-year durability from a single dose, to deliver large genetic payloads, including multiple genes, to specific tissues, and to allow titration and redosing to adjust or extend expression levels in each patient. RES has the potential to expand Generation Bios manufacturing scale to hundreds of millions of doses to support its mission to extend the reach of genetic medicine to more people, living with more diseases, around the world. We are a thriving, collaborative, creative community of people with diverse talents, beliefs, and experiences headquartered in , . further. Please visit www.generationbio.com or follow generationbio. To see additional roles, please also check out https: generationbio.com careers SUMMARY: Generation Bio is seeking an energetic and highly motivated Scientist to join the hematopoietic stem cells HSC team within the Discovery Research group. The position will play a key role in development and evaluation of our cell targeted lipid nanoparticle ctLNP delivery platform by developing and executing in vitro and in vivo assays aimed at evaluating ctLNPs interacting with HSCs. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cell-based assays such as, but not limited to HSC colony forming assay, ELISAs and flow cytometry and experience in HSC engraftment in immunodeficient mice model, isolating and maintaining HSCs, and other primary immune cells. Experience in ex vivo and in vivo gene editing in HSC and primary cells is preferred. Responsibilities will also include cross-functional research to enable early program development for indications in target cell types. RESPONSIBILITIES: Contribute to the design, optimization and execution of assays to assess ctLNP interactions with HSC and primary immune cells. Work with Discovery Organization to evaluate novel ctLNPs and target biology for new platform technologies. Support discovery effort for in vivo cell targeted delivery. Summarize work in written reports and oral presentations. QUALIFICATIONS: Experience in the fields of hematology or cell biology or related Ph.D. in hematology or biochemistry or molecular biology or related field of study with minimum of of industry experience, including strong publication records. Demonstrated leadership and hands on experience in primary HSC based assay development and execution. Experience isolating and culturing HSCs and primary immune cells from human and or mice required. Knowledge of flow cytometry and simple multi-color panel design required. Experience with CRISPR Cas-based genome editing desired. Experience with QPCR, western blot techniques, ELISAs, etc a plus. Ability to work cross functionally in a dynamic matrixed environment. Ability to multi-task to support multiple projects across platform discovery organization. Organized, excellent communication skills, collaborative mindset. POSITION: Full-Time, Exempt More Information on Generation Bio Generation Bio operates in the Biotech industry. The company is located in , . Generation Bio was founded in . It has total employees. To see all open jobs at Generation Bio, click here.

descriptionShort: Gauntlet leads the field in quantitative research and optimization of DeFi economics. We manage market risk, optimize growth, and ensure economic safety for protocols facilitating the majority of spot trading, borrowing, and lending activity across all of DeFi, protecting and optimizing the largest protocols and networks in the industry. As of Gauntlet manages risk and incentives covering over 13 billion in customer TVL. Gauntlet continually publishes cutting-edge research that informs our risk models, alerts, and analysis, and is among the most cited institution including academic institutions in terms of peer-reviewed papers addressing DeFi as a subject. Were a Series B company with employees, operating remote-first with a home base in . Gauntlets mission is to drive adoption and understanding in the financial systems of the future. Building with decentralized systems creates novel challenges for mechanism designers, smart contract developers, and end-users of financial products, which are not seen in traditional software development and investing contexts. Gauntlet is dedicated to enhancing our industrys understanding of this new domain, and revealing how to safely navigate the true bleeding edge of financial innovation. In order to grow our impact in the DeFi space we are looking to hire experienced Data Scientists to help new and established protocols better understand the systems theyve built. This role will require establishing a strong ability to analyze and interpret data as well as the ability to collaborate with and manage external clients. You will be working directly with the premier and innovative DeFi protocols and developing expert-level knowledge and experience of the mechanisms that underpin the DeFi industry. Responsibilities Perform in depth novel research into how to make premier DeFi protocols safer and more efficient through mechanism design, data analysis, and dynamic parameter optimization. Take ownership of client engagements, scoping out work, managing client relationships, and delivering value to clients through your research and work. Draft and write engaging research for public consumption both to grow Gauntlets Brand as well as to satisfy client requirements Build and deploy easy-to-understand and visually compelling dashboards for internal and external consumption Qualifications of professional experience Extremely clear and effective communication and client management skills Proven track record of drawing deep insights from complex datasets Experience with data querying languages e.g. SQL, scripting languages e.g. Python, and or statistical mathematical software e.g. R Ability to work independently working towards abstract goals Experience working with pricing models, financial products and or different asset classes Bonus Points Enthusiasm for the space, especially DeFi, is very much desired Experience with derivatives style products Experience managing external client relationships Published or presented research in the space Remote - work from anywhere in the CAN! Regular in-person company retreats and cross-country office visit perkLaptop, monitor, keyboard and mouse setup provided WFH stipend reimbursement for home internet, phone, and cellular data Unlimited vacation Please note at this time our hiring is reserved for potential employees who are able to work within the contiguous and . Should you need alternative accommodations, please note that in your application. LI-Remote

descriptionShort: Who are we Buyers Edge Platform is one of the fastest-growing companies in the exciting Foodservice Technology industry. Buyers Edge Platform is made up of companies who work together to help restaurants and other foodservice operators reduce their costs, streamline their supply chains, and utilize technology to run their businesses more efficiently and profitably. We are driven by our entrepreneurial spirit, diverse portfolio of companies and our inclusive and collaborative atmosphere. Our values-focused culture is best experienced at of our offices, including marquee locations in , , , CT and , . This position is remote and based around working hours. We are unable to offer work sponsorship for this role. We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist that enjoys diving into vast datasets, tackling intricate data preprocessing tasks, and conveying complex systems and algorithms to stakeholders. As a pivotal member of our organization, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, crafting robust data pipelines, and deriving valuable insights, including predictive suggestions on purchased data. Your impact: Machine Learning Algorithm Development and Predictive Modeling: Utilize your expertise in machine learning to develop algorithms that analyze and interpret large datasets. Design and implement models that provide valuable insights, predictive suggestions, and accurate forecasting on consumer behavior, product preferences, and market trends. Data Pipeline Development and Data Handling: Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from various sources. Process and manipulate large amounts of data efficiently, ensuring data integrity, quality, and availability. Implement data preprocessing techniques as part of the data pipeline to prepare datasets for analysis and modeling. Data Analysis and Exploration: Conduct thorough data analysis and exploration to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies within large datasets. Utilize statistical techniques and visualization tools to uncover meaningful insights and drive data-driven decision-making. Independent Problem Solving: Work independently on complex systems and algorithms, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle challenges effectively. Take ownership of projects and drive them to successful completion, meeting both technical and business objectives. Communication and Stakeholder Engagement: Effectively communicate complex technical concepts and the results of your analyses to stakeholders. Articulate the intricacies of systems, algorithms, and insights in a clear and concise manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions. Collaboration and Teamwork: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to gather requirements, understand business objectives, and align data science initiatives with organizational goals. About you: Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field. experience in a data science role. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python. Pandas experience required. Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and libraries e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch. Experience working with large datasets and developing data pipelines for data extraction, transformation and loading. Proficiency in pandas for efficient data handling and manipulation. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions. Attention to detail and a passion for working with complex datasets. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience presenting finding and insights to stakeholders at various levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability to work independently on complex systems and algorithms. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. What's in this for you Live well Work well. Relax with our Personal Responsibility Paid Time Off policy where you dont have to accrue time off in order to take it! We also offer Summer Fridays! We welcome all. We welcome all. descriptionShort: The Vita Coco Company is the leading coconut water brand created in by Co-CEO Michael Kirban and Ira Liran. Pioneers in the functional beverage category, Vita Coco has brought coconut water into the mainstream beverage aisle rebranding it as a premium lifestyle drink. The Vita Coco Companys brands include the leading coconut water, Vita Coco clean energy drink RUNA sustainable enhanced water, Ever Ever and protein-infused water, PWR LIFT. In , The Vita Coco Company became a publicly traded, Public Benefit Corporation PBC solidifying its position as a modern beverage platform built for current and future generations. With a growing portfolio of natural products, The Vita Coco Company has identified its public benefit purpose as harnessing, while protecting, natures resources for the betterment of the world and its habitants by creating ethical, sustainable, products that not only uplift our communities, but that do right by our planet. In , The Vita Coco Company was certified as a B Corporation furthering the Companys commitment toward operating its business as a force for good, while delivering better-for-you products. Vita Coco is headquartered in with international offices in and . Vita Coco is seeking Master Data Specialist for a new role in our Operations department. This role will work with all departments of the operations team to ensure the integrity of master data for our and operations. Master Data Specialist to report directly to the Director of Planning and Inventory Management, . This role will be based out of our HQ-NY Office we currently have a in-office requirement, to work from our office. Main Responsibilities: Coordinate all Supply Chain master data item set-up and maintenance in and MDM. Own the lifecycle of SKUs for market and work with team to review ensuring data is updated in a timely manner. Work closely with our Optimization team in office to ensure and act as ATC air traffic control for any changes being pushed into the market. Own automate the UPC book to make necessary data available to other parts of the organization. Be the point person for the rest of the organization outside of Ops team for any SKU master data. Project manage any master data updates through the supply chain. Build out timelines with all necessary steps and ensure all supply chain departments are informed of changes. Support the roll out of new Master Data Management tool, working cross-functionally with IT finance, ensuring Operations data is available as needed. Create documentation for workflow and processes and train team members on this. Work with IT team to automate master data activity where appropriate. Be the expert for supply chain master data and provide guidance to the team to ensure best practice is followed in all departments. Act as quality control for SKU master data and work with functional teams to correct data as needed. Qualifications: Bachelors degree or higher, ideally in Supply Chain, Business or related field. Ability to build relationships across all levels of seniority within multiple departments both internally and externally. In-depth knowledge of SAP Experience with MDM tools such as Informatica is a bonus! More Information on Vita Coco Vita Coco operates in the Food industry. The company is located in , . Vita Coco was founded in . It has total employees. To see all open jobs at Vita Coco, click here.

descriptionShort: Butlr is on a mission to make the built environment people-aware. Think about it: we live and work in houses and buildings that aren't really aware of their inhabitants. As a result, we heat and cool spaces when no one is in them, clean areas that haven't been used, and lease office space that are never really occupied. Our vision is to enable smarter buildings and increase the quality of life by making spaces people-aware without compromising privacy. To do so, we have developed our People Sensing Platform which anonymously infers human presence and activity via its thermal, wireless sensors. Through our novel technology, we deliver rich spatial insights at a fraction of the cost and time of legacy alternatives. Spun out of the MIT Media Lab in with offices in and , Butlr was founded by Forbes Under 30 entrepreneurs Honghao Deng and Jiani Zeng. Since , we have been working with of top occupiers, landlords, and service providers in , , and , in addition to partners in senior living and retail. Our mission is backed by some of the strongest leaders in the industry, such as Qualcomm Ventures, Tiger Global, Carrier, and Ray Stata, co-founder of Analog Devices. We proudly serve of fortune companies, along with some of the largest brands in the world. As weve been growing rapidly per year, were hiring talented and passionate people to join our team and work with us towards our mission to make the built environment people-aware! About the Job: Reporting to the Head of Software, this role will be the technical lead for OpenCV and ML at Butlr. OpenCV and ML will be used in both detection and pose estimation for Butlr Solutions. Responsibilities: Lead the development of an OpenCV based detection algorithms using the multiple types of thermal sensors that are in Butlrs portfolio. Help in developing the already started pose estimation for fall detection and lead the development of other pose estimations that are more advanced. With the team develop and lead a plan to develop a production ready OpenCV based product. Work with the team to review existing ideas and flush out the requirements and possible solutions to use openCV and ML to develop the Butlr product. Own the development of critical parts of the current Butlr solution and finding the direction of new ones. Requirements: PhD MS in engineering, technology, computer science, machine learning, robotics, operations research, statistics, mathematics or equivalent quantitative field of experience in solving computer vision problems Experience developing fullstack computer vision systems including - sensor selection, calibration, robust algorithm development and monitoring at scale Excellent communication skills, both written and oral with both technical and business people. Ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience. Proficiency in OO language: C, GO Proficiency in scripting functional language: Python, Bash, C CI CD development experience and associated technologies Preferred: Experience building complex software systems, especially involving deep learning, machine learning and computer vision, that have been successfully delivered to customers Preferred: Experience in large data systems Preferred: Experience in IoT Location: This is a remote position. World class team with low egos Founders won Forbes Under 30 distinction in World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer Supportive investors such as Founder Collective, Hyperplane, E14 Fund and Startups, including amazing angel investors such as the founders of Whoop, Simplisafe, and the Chief Product Officer at Adobe A flexible work environment Generous paid time off Why working at Butlr is great! We are building a culture that puts people ! Were a team of engaging, motivated, and intelligent problem-solvers committed to making an impact. We believe in fostering a healthy work-life balance culture and encourage an inviting, collaborative, fun work environment. Disclaimers Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

descriptionShort: Intuit Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 130 million members globally. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for everything related to their financial goals, including identity monitoring, applying for credit cards, shopping for insurance and loans car, home and personal and savings accounts and checking accounts -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through : we now have employees across our offices in , , , , and . Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC Senior Partner Decision Scientist Credit Karma is working to make financial progress possible for everyone. Data and analytics play a pivotal role in this mission and every part of our business informing new product design, driving marketing efficiency, and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our members. Were seeking an analytical, driven and results-oriented individual to join the Partner Decision Science team. In this role, you will use your analytical and strategic experience to create data-driven business recommendations that develop and deepen relations with our Credit Card, Personal Loan and Auto Loan partners, ranging from startup fintechs to the largest financial institutions in the world. This role has high visibility and will contribute meaningfully to Credit Karmas revenue growth. Youll work on analytics for Easy Apply API which reduces application friction. Youll contribute to building out frameworks for evaluating decisions and product trajectory. And youll do all of this within a high growth technology company whose mission is making financial progress possible for Credit Karma's members. What the job entails Leverage internal and external data to develop business recommendations that generate value for Credit Karma and our partners Thoroughly understand the capabilities of the Credit Karma Easy Apply API, help drive requirements and identify enhancements to current capabilities Design and build performance dashboards to measure the health and risks of our business Unlike some analytics functions, you are not a service provider. Youre a thought leader to the product, presenting fact based recommendations that drive the Credit Karma business forward Success in the role will correlate closely to your ability to influence product decisions, identify opportunities for growth or improvement, and drive adoption with our lending partners Build strong relations with analytical and data science teams at financial institutions Minimum Requirements Bachelor's or Masters Degree in math, data science, engineering, business, marketing, finance, or economics from an accredited college or university of financial services, consulting or a similar strategic or analytical experience Proficient in SQL Python Experience with digital funnel and or product analysis is strongly preferred Experience interfacing with teams at Financial institutions preferred Familiarity with credit bureau data is preferred Our ideal candidate Adept at collecting, analyzing and synthesizing data to support strategies and communications internally and externally Has the ability to communicate qualitative and quantitative results clearly, succinctly and confidently in verbal and written communications Incredibly responsive and solution oriented, operates at a high tempo, and has an unrelenting drive to see efforts through to positive impacts on our members and partners Highly organized and detail oriented able to successfully manage and prioritize numerous projects Thrives in ambiguity, requires minimal oversight, and can independently and thoughtfully develop and implement recommended approaches to complex problems Able to quickly understand our partner ecosystem and use that knowledge to advance the goals of our partners and our business Both curious and creative, consisting seeking out ways to improve our partnerships and business Ability to work cross functionally and assert influence internally externally Team player that doesnt view fun and work as mutually exclusive Retirement descriptionShort: Summary Responsible for modeling complex healthcare inquiries, discovering insights, and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, data-mining, and visualization techniques. Integrate and analyze large, varied datasets and communicate the results of large-scale analytics. Description Logistics: This position is onsite at 4101 Percival Road, , . What You'll Do: Support decision-making by building, maintaining, and improving multiple analytic systems collaboratively. Design experiments, test hypotheses, and build analytical models to explore, explain, and predict health-related outcomes. Model and frame meaningful healthcare scenarios that impact strategic direction throughout the healthcare business. Work closely with clients, data stewards, project managers, and Information Systems teams to turn healthcare data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions. Collaborate with subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information. Educate the organization from technical and business perspectives on advanced analytic approaches. Help the organization understand the principles and the computational analysis behind processes to ensure organizational support. Work with data stewards to ensure compliance with existing governance, regulatory, architecture, and security policies. Apply statistical descriptive, analytical, inferential analysis and data mining techniques to generate real-world evidence and prediction systems for stand-alone projects or to be assimilated into production systems. Provide evidence that is congruent and reliable. Work iteratively to validate findings using experimental design, scenario modeling, and sensitivity analyses. Conduct data analyses that range from simple descriptive statistics to highly complex algorithms. Develop innovative and effective approaches to solving analytics problems. Communicate results and methodologies with transparency. Identify, generate, and apply the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns. Come up with solutions to broadly defined business needs by leveraging pattern detection over complex datasets. Present findings to the business leaders through presentations, dashboards, or other analytical output. Provide method validation with assumptions, strengths, and limitations in a way that stakeholders can easily understand. Recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to more efficient processes. To Qualify for This Position, You'll Need the Following: Required Education: Master's degree in Data Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Mathematics, Health Economics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Informatics, or related field OR Doctorate Ph.D. in Data Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Mathematics, Health Economics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Informatics, or related field Required Work Experience: of relevant quantitative and qualitative analytics experience. Ph.D. training will be counted as of experience Required Software and tools: Microsoft Office, SQL, Statistical programming tools such as R, Python, or SAS Required Skills and Abilities: Proficiency in using SQL to query large, complex datasets. Strong programming, analytical, and problem-solving skills Knowledge of statistical techniques, including statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, predictive analytics, and multivariate testing Ability to innovate and collaborate Team player who is proactive and detail-oriented We Prefer That You Have The Following: Experience with healthcare financial analysis and program evaluation Experience with data management in relational data sources Experience creating dashboards and visualizations with Tableau or PowerBI Experience working with healthcare data Experience with Value Based Care programs Strong written, verbal, presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills 401k retirement savings plan with company match Fantastic health plans and free vision coverage Life insurance Paid leave - the longer you work here, the more you earn paid holidays On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in significant locations Wellness programs and a healthy lifestyle premium discount Tuition assistance Service Recognition What We Can Do for You: We understand the value of a diverse and inclusive workplace and strive to be an employer where employees across all spectrums have the opportunity to develop their skills, advance their careers and contribute their unique abilities to the growth of our company. What to Expect Next: Some states have required notifications. Here's more information. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. jobTitle: Support Scientist Develop Validate Aerosol Algorithms Products
descriptionShort: Candidates must be citizens or green card holders and have established residency in the for . We are seeking a talented and motivated Atmospheric Scientist to join our dynamic team focused on developing and validating atmospheric aerosol algorithms and products. In this role, you will play a crucial part in advancing our understanding of aerosol processes, improving algorithms, and ensuring the accuracy and reliability of our aerosol-related products. Work as part of a team supporting NOAA scientists to develop, maintain, and validate algorithms for sensing aerosols, water vapor, and trace gases from satellites. Trace gases may include NO2, SO2, and O3 and sensors may include polar and geostationary NOAA and NOAA-partner satellites. Duties Responsibilities: Provide scientific and technical expertise on the retrieval and or analysis of aerosol products from METimage and the Multi-viewing, Multi-channel, Multi-polarization Imager 3MI onboard the polar-orbiting METOP-SG satellites. Support the development of algorithms for retrieving aerosol optical depth from observations from advanced Imagers onboard the GOES-R, Himawari, and Meteosat Third Generation series geostationary satellites. Explore the potential synergistic use of aerosol products aerosol optical depth, size distribution, single scattering albedo, particle shape derived from space-based polarimeters like and those from NASA's Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, and ocean Ecosystem mission to improve imager-based aerosol optical depth products. Explore other ways to improve the quality of products and or efficiency of retrievals, for example, by applying Machine Learning. Interact with the user community, especially air quality and climate provide information on the quality of available aerosol products and understand user requirements. Prepare or assist in preparing technical reports and presentations to communicate project progress. Publish research results in peer-reviewed journals. Contingency Note: This position is contingent upon the successful award of a contract. While we are optimistic about the outcome, the final confirmation of the position is subject to contract approval. Next Phase is a member of the incumbent team. Requirements Qualifications: A Master's degree PhD preferred in Atmospheric Science PREFERRED, Earth Science, Geophysics, or Environmental Science. of experience in remote sensing, atmospheric sciences, or a related field is required. Knowledge of and experience in high-level programming languages such as C, Fortran, and Python is necessary. Excellent communication and presentation skills and demonstrated experience writing scientific and technical documents are essential. Good interpersonal and teamwork skills are also required. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of current, specific methods used for satellite retrievals of aerosol properties and current aerosol products. Experience with the application of Machine Learning and artificial intelligence. Familiarity with scientific data formats such as netCDF, HDF, and EOS-HDF. Required Qualifications: Must be citizens or green card holders and have established residency in the for . This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Additional Information about this opening: Employees of Next Phase shall, as an enduring obligation throughout their term of employment, adhere to all information security requirements as documented in company policies and procedures Enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work environment, with in the office , , and and working remotely We are committed to your professional growth, providing opportunities for advancement and exposure to exciting projects and initiatives This position is suited for candidates within commuting distance to , and not eligible for a fully remote schedule ABOUT NEXT PHASE SOLUTIONS AND SERVICES, INC. Next Phase commits to creating an environment where our employees achieve their full potential, increase productivity, and expand their professional and personal horizons. We look for bright, innovative people who achieve results, understand the importance of being productive and supportive team members, and prioritize customer satisfaction. descriptionShort: Requisition Number: Position Title: Data Scientist II External Description: Senior Data Scientist Location: , , We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination. Data-driven decision-making is essential to game development at EA. We're looking for a thoughtful and disciplined leader with deep statistical modeling experience, strong data engineering experience and a passion for games and digital technologies. The biggest and single most important aspect that we look for in aspiring colleagues is people who enjoy the joy of discovery. You will report to a senior data science manager within EA's central Data and Analytics DnA organization. You will work with top data science talent and the latest technology on live services and in-game features specifically for Madden that will lead to a unique opportunity to affect the game played by of players. You're passionate about elevating insights to be actionable across projects, and accelerating learning through data-driven testing. This opportunity is based in , and you can adopt a flexible hybrid working style. What you'll do: Work directly with the Madden game team partners internal clients to understand their offerings domain and create data science products and solutions to solve for their use cases. Assist our team's lead of Live Services with generalizing products across titles. Work on team projects within your pillar live service, proposing methodology and guiding the direction of each project. Ensure high-quality methodology and experimental design and how experiments can produce actionable, trustworthy conclusions. Effectively communicate data science projects and products to stakeholders, including those non-data science backgrounds knowledge. Design, improve and work with our data pipeline that transfers and processes petabytes of data using S3, Kubernetes, Sagemaker, GCP, Python, Apache Kafka, Hive. Use data manipulation, processing, and data visualizations to aid in your modeling efforts. Leverage your statistical and computational knowledge to build algorithms for calculating variances, state predictions, and find trends. Assist game teams and data teams in making key business decisions. Mentor and coach junior team members. You Have: of professional experience manipulating data sets, building statistical models, and productizing models along with experience applying Data Science methodologies to real-world problems. Ph.D. Master's in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field encouraged. Experience working on a mix of recommendation, personalization, matchmaking, and forecast modeling. Experienced in analyzing extremely complex, multi-dimensional data sets with a variety of tools. Superior verbal, visual, and written communication skills to educate and work with cross-functional teams. Experience using Python, SQL, PyTorch TensorFlow, Hive Hadoop, and AWS GCP.
